title: Man Utd 3-2 Arsenal: Michael Carrick describes win as 'perfect night' to end Old Trafford career
description: Michael Carrick describes the 3-2 win over Arsenal as "the perfect night" to end his 15-year association with Manchester United as he is leaving the club following his spell as caretaker manager.

title: Shell pulls out of Shetland oil field development
description: The oil giant said the economic case for investment in the controversial project was "not strong enough".

title: How do you say Omicron?
description: Omicron is the 13th variant of the Covid-19 virus to receive a Greek name but the pronunciation is up for debate.

title: Will Meghan's big win change public opinion?
description: The Duchess of Sussex has won her court case over privacy, but interest in her is not going to go away.

title: Quiz of the week: Who beat Taylor Swift on most streamed artist list?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Arthur Labinjo-Hughes: A life cut short by cruelty
description: The six-year-old was beaten, starved and isolated by his father and stepmother before he was killed.

title: Asbestos exposure from 20 years ago killed IT worker
description: Jason Williams was given months to live when he became ill due to asbestos exposure 20 years ago.

title: Covid bereaved families 'sickened' over No 10 Christmas party
description: Covid bereaved families campaigners call for apology from Boris Johnson over lockdown gathering.

title: Covid: South Africa new cases double in 24 hours as Omicron spreads
description: The new Omicron variant has now become dominant, the country's top medical scientists say.

title: Government fined £500,000 for New Year honours data breach
description: The addresses of more than 1,000 people, including Sir Elton John and Gabby Logan, were shared online.

title: The big company Christmas party is off this year
description: Companies are deciding against holding a big bash in favour of allowing small, optional gatherings.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell: Defence lawyers seek to discredit key accuser
description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defence team try to poke holes in an alleged victim's testimony at her trial.

title: Meghan wins ruling in Mail on Sunday privacy fight
description: The Duchess of Sussex took action after the paper carried extracts of a letter to her father.

title: 'My teenager layers himself in coats to keep warm'
description: A charity estimates that domestic gas bills in April will be double those of 18 months earlier.

title: Supreme Court: Top US judges signal support for abortion limits
description: The court's eventual ruling may cut off abortion access for tens of millions of American women.

title: Stokes takes two wickets on England return
description: Ben Stokes makes his first appearance since July as England begin their rain-delayed last Ashes warm-up match against England Lions.

title: Home Alone house available to book on Airbnb
description: The home from the 1990 Christmas classic starring Macaulay Culkin will be available for one night only.

title: UK approves another antibody treatment for Covid
description: It's called sotrovimab and should cut the risk of severe illness, even for new variants such as Omicron, say scientists.

title: Pfizer boss: Annual Covid jabs for years to come
description: In an exclusive interview, Dr Albert Bourla says jabs have saved millions of lives.

title: Covid: Trigger of rare blood clots with AstraZeneca jab found by scientists
description: Researchers in Cardiff and the US work out how the Covid jab may be linked to the extremely rare clots.

title: Louis Watkiss: Parents held son as he died in SnowDome crash
description: Louis Watkiss, 12, was pronounced dead in front of his father minutes after he arrived at the scene.

title: 'I was sexually harassed and Tube staff gave me a leaflet'
description: An Instagram influencer explains how being accosted on the Tube was only the start of her ordeal.

title: The Papers: 'Let it flow' and more booster jabs ordered
description: The front pages lead with recommendations to curb Covid cases over Christmas and extra jabs being ordered.

title: Covid: Don't kiss strangers under mistletoe - minister
description: People should try to reduce Covid transmission so we can all enjoy Christmas "knees up", Therese Coffey says.

title: Disney appoints woman as chairman for first time in 98-year history
description: Susan Arnold, who has been a board member for 14 years, will succeed Bob Iger at the end of the year.

title: Why this wildlife expert is making his archive public
description: After 55 years recording the sounds of nature, Martyn Stewart has decided to share his life's work.

title: Will two-year football kit cycles become the norm again?
description: Brentford FC's keeping its home shirt for two seasons - and some say other teams may follow suit.

title: When Jesus is used to steal from his flock
description: William Neil "Doc" Gallagher used Christian radio to defraud religious pensioners out of millions.

title: Epstein accuser: Maxwell a master manipulator
description: The BBC spoke to Teresa Helm, who accused Epstein of sexually assaulting her at the age of 22.

title: How I got my dream job with a Tube station pitch
description: Haider Malik landed a dream position after finding a unique way to attract employers' attention.

title: Dragged up the stairs for my hospital appointment
description: The healthcare system lacks equipment, buildings are crumbling and many healthcare workers have left in search of better lives.

title: 'No middle ground': Chile voters face tough choice as run-off looms
description: Voters speak of the divisions as an ultra-conservative and a left-winger battle it out.

title: Social care: Teen twins search for personal assistant
description: Alex and Sam, who have spinal muscular atrophy, are struggling to find the support they need.

title: Everton 1-4 Liverpool: How 'deadly' Mo Salah decided Merseyside derby - Match of the Day analysis
description: Match of the Day pundit Ashley Williams praises Mo Salah's performance against Everton after the Liverpool forward scored twice in a 4-1 win at Goodison Park.

title: Would you give 10% of your salary to charity?
description: A growing number of people are deciding to give up a substantial chunk of their wages.

title: ‘It’s like hell in here’: The struggle to save Afghanistan's starving babies
description: Doctors in Afghanistan’s crisis-hit hospitals are caring for their patients in almost impossible conditions.

title: Stanley Menzo: Ajax's former goalkeeper on dealing with racism in Dutch game
description: Stanley Menzo would encounter racism almost every week on the football pitch. When a young man abused him to his face, he struck back.
